Jim Street.Action: Described as indomitably cheerful and making everything look easy during the SWAT operation.
Leads a stealth infiltration with calm, confidence, and ease, making everything look easy.
Makes a 'Shhh' sign to the wounded guard who pleads for help with his eyes, indicating sensitivity and understanding of the guard's plight.
Communicates clearly and calmly with Poker and Hondo under difficult radio conditions, showing teamwork and trustworthiness.
Steps into the alley to be seen by Hondo for silent communication, demonstrating cooperation and consideration for the team.
Clambers over a razor-wire topped gate without hesitation while others hesitate.
Oils the hinges with WD-40 and carefully opens the door, using a rubber stop to keep it open.
Makes a quiet 'shhh' sign to Poker to avoid alerting the suspects.
Communicates with Hondo via hand signs to receive and relay tactical information despite radio interference.
Follows the sergeant’s orders to pull back to avoid spooking suspects during negotiation.
Peers down hallway with inspection mirror, assesses hostage situation calmly.
Shares alarmed looks with teammate indicating concern for hostage's safety.
Attempts to use radio despite failure, showing persistence in protecting others.
Uses an inspection mirror to safely peer down the hallway during hostage situation.
Tries the radio but receives no response, indicating an attempt to communicate despite poor conditions.
Reaches a decision quickly in high-pressure hostage situation along with teammate Poker.
Instructs the frightened counter girl to escape before tossing a stun grenade to incapacitate threats.
Fires on an accomplice holding a woman hostage without hesitation, ensuring her safety.
Fearlessly charges the armed Barricaded Robber to protect his team despite personal risk.
Reports suspects in custody and prioritizes calling paramedics despite tense situation.
Defends his and Poker’s aggressive tactic by emphasizing imminent threat to hostage.
Trades relieved grins with Poker after successful resolution.
Expresses anxiety and acknowledges possibility of being fired, showing vulnerability.
Defends his and Poker's actions by referencing thank-you letters from a victim's family, showing respect and sincere belief in doing the right thing.
Hesitates to follow Poker immediately when Poker suggests leaving, indicating internal conflict or concern.
Complies respectfully with the SWAT Captain's orders despite feeling unjustly reprimanded, showing tolerance and restraint.
Disobeys direct orders from SWAT Captain, insists on doing what he believes is right despite chain of command.
Speaks respectfully and tries to justify actions based on moral justification and support from community.
Looks at SWAT patch with regret but complies with reassignment without protest.
Hesitates when his partner abruptly leaves, showing uncertainty and lack of decisiveness.
Refuses immediate medical attention after a severe injury and uses a sarcastic parting remark toward Poker.
Pours coffee with additives carefully and shows focus on physical and mental well-being, settles into paperwork calmly after a run.
Displays memorabilia and trophies from team activities, indicating pride in team and achievements.
Runs full tilt through downtown L.A., vaults concrete barriers without slowing, and promptly settles into his work with preparedness (coffee mix, vitamins, protein powder).
Shows signs of nostalgia or fixation on past achievements through a 'shrine to better days' including trophies and photos.
Grins knowingly at Boxer's bad lie about the raise, indicating friendly teasing and camaraderie.
Encourages Boxer to talk to Hondo and expresses readiness for a comeback, showing openness and supportiveness.
Responds to TJ's insult with a glare and a sharp retort, showing defensiveness and hostility.
References his healed scars with a proud, positive attitude in front of Hondo, showing sincere self-disclosure and acceptance.
Grins when Boxer, a bad liar, tries to hide information, showing social awareness and confidence.
Volunteers to outfit the new SWAT crew, indicating readiness and responsibility.
Offends TJ by calling him 'trigger happy has-been' and glares threateningly, showing poor emotional control.
Asks Boxer honestly if he would trust Street to rescue his grandmother, seeking feedback and validation.
Points out his healed arm scars, demonstrating resilience and physical recovery, implying capability.
Invites Hondo to come teach a survival class, showing openness and inclusiveness.
Trains the rookie with martial arts, engaging directly and teaching through practical demonstration.
Expresses confidence that he is better than other applicants in a somewhat boastful manner.
Watches the team leave and internally acknowledges his dissatisfaction alone and isolated.
States that he passed his physical and claims his skills are razor sharp, better than two years ago.
Confidently asserts he was born to work SWAT and is better than all other highly qualified applicants.
Conducts martial arts instruction to other officers, effectively demonstrating a move and successfully subduing a cocky rookie.
Watches the SWAT team leave, showing a moment of frustration and resignation, acknowledging 'This sucks.'
Offers to teach rookie street survival skills.
Accepts challenge from experienced officer Bermudez despite intimidation.
Offers to teach the rookie survival skills and shows confidence in his daily training.
Feels wary and senses a potential setup before the fight with Bermudez.
Reacts with intimidation to the aggressive attack and reputation of Bermudez.
Puffs with pride at winning the fight and boasts 'The Street sweeper dominates.'
Taps fists with some buddies after winning, showing camaraderie.
Realizes Hondo's disapproval and grows serious but expectant, showing some social awareness.
Gets hold of Bermudez's arm and nearly pulls it out of its socket, winning the fight.
Shows pride and confidence after winning, but picks a fight with Hondo despite sensing disapproval.
Lunges at Hondo and engages in a fight where he is repeatedly outmatched and ends up in pain and helpless.
Refuses to tap out despite pain and the risk of serious injury, showing determination but poor judgment.
Gets up despite being warned he might get hurt, showing determination and resilience.
Initially jumps back from Hondo's hand instead of shaking it, indicating mistrust or poor social intuition.
Accepts his second chance and shakes Hondo's hand, demonstrating willingness to cooperate and adapt.
Knows how to find key information on a long list (finding Deacon Kaye's name), exhibiting attention to detail and knowledge.
Asks a positive/negative attitude question to Hondo, signaling some uncertainty or probing but possibly guardedness.
Offers help to Officer Kay while chasing suspects.
Takes initiative by overtaking colleagues and aggressively apprehending a suspect.
Suggests choosing team member based on performance and least complaints, showing practical but fair judgment.
Comments sympathetically about injured Officer Sanchez, acknowledging the tough fight and respecting Sanchez's toughness.
Studies the printout, runs the numbers in his head quickly and logically to determine the best candidate for the team.
Judges candidates based on a combination of physical ability and complaint record, showing practical and intelligent evaluation.
Briefly comments on the severity of injuries to Sanchez.
Slides the curtain back confidently to reveal the scene.
Jokes that he is illiterate when introduced to Denise Sanchez, calling it a typo.
Not actively participating or contributing to the tactical discussion or physical action in this excerpt.
Looks impressed when Hondo gives Sanchez a business card and they shake warmly
Trades cold looks with TJ
Taps fists with Deke, thanks him after compliment during obstacle course.
Turns to a disappointed TJ and says, 'But not quick enough.'
Shoots TJ a look when TJ calls him 'evil twin' jokingly.
Tries to keep up with teammates, trips but does not complain; responds positively to Hondo when called out to improve footwork.
Shows tension with Hondo over physical difficulties but still admits limitations and agrees to continue training.
Joins team in grueling training showing commitment and solidarity.
Trips while moving with the team during a tactical exercise, causing all three to fall down.
Acknowledges his physical limitation and expresses willingness to improve when confronted by Hondo.
Shows physical signs of strain and injury during training but continues to participate despite difficulty.
Acknowledges TJ's mistake with a thankful look, demonstrating appreciation despite being unfairly blamed initially.
Shakes his head and declines an invitation to dinner with the team, showing possible social withdrawal or discomfort.
Helps serve food at the family barbecue, indicating willingness to support and participate in communal activities.
Accidentally triggers flashlight on weapon, compromising team's position.
Accepts responsibility of a minor error silently and endures team's implicit reproach without complaint.
Refuses to join team dinner, indicating possible disengagement but does not disrupt team cohesion.
Looks at pictures of Deke as a kid and teases him lightly about being a nerd and his past nickname, engaging in friendly banter.
Participates in casual conversation, showing interest in teammate's background and sharing own experiences.
Lightheartedly teases and interacts comfortably with teammates, showing social ease and confidence.
Engages in casual conversation about past and tattoos without showing ignorance or confusion.
Does not exhibit any clear signs of incompetence or lack of skill in this excerpt.
Moves cautiously and participates actively in a practice assault exercise, showing engagement with training.
Gets hit with training paint balls and is 'dead' before reaching the target during the drill.
Acknowledges the pain from paint balls with some humor, indicating resilience and composure.
Pours beer for his team at the bar, showing off his server skills in a friendly group setting.
Congratulates Sanchez on his son's swimming success with friendly teasing about 'high speed genes'.
Shares casual details about his home life (MP3s and Playstation), showing openness and camaraderie.
Engages in light-hearted banter with Hondo about lifestyle choices, showing tolerance and friendliness.
Engages with team members comfortably, shows good rapport and humor.
Expresses positive attitude about SWAT and its challenges.
No direct demonstration of skill, knowledge, or decisive action in the excerpt.
Openly shares his feelings with Hondo about sticking with SWAT and needing to get back in the house, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Defends his tough decision during the jewelry store incident, showing commitment to the team's safety and trustworthiness.
Shows frustration and jaw grinding after Hondo questions his judgment, indicating tension but also willingness to confront issues honestly.
Demonstrates appreciation and respect toward Hondo after receiving vindication, calling him 'a deep cat,' reflecting warmth and a friendly, sincere connection.
Expresses awe and respect for Hondo's disciplined training environment, indicating humility and recognition of skill.
States he made a decisive tactical choice during a jewelry store incident to prevent a bloodbath, showing situational awareness and decisiveness.
Remains firm and confident despite Hondo doubting him initially, demonstrating resilience and confidence in his judgment.
Questions why Hondo didn't tell the captain about giving him a second chance, showing some lack of communication or understanding of internal politics.
Shows concern for Hondo's well-being after his serious talk.
Sets his jaw in anger when told they can't pass and retest isn't soon.
Challenges Hondo's belief in the team's success with 'You don't believe in us, do you?'
Sets jaw in anger after hearing they likely cannot pass the test and no retest for six months.
Questions Hondo about the advanced scenario and expresses determination not to 'go back in the cage.'
Senses something is wrong when Hondo looks strained before the briefing.
Suggests a SWAT huddle for team solidarity and leads the group in a moment of silent prayer.
Leads the team into the plane first and actively engages in the training exercise, covering teammates by neutralizing threats.
Suggests a SWAT huddle before the exercise, showing leadership and situational awareness.
First to enter the aircraft during the drill, demonstrating confidence and readiness.
Effectively engages multiple hijackers with accurate fire, hitting targets consistently under high-pressure conditions.
Runs up the aisle quickly and shoots the hijacker aiming at him, displaying alertness and marksmanship under pressure.
Dives and rolls down the aisle effectively to dodge danger and reposition himself for the next shot.
Successfully shoots a surprised hijacker about to shoot the team, showing accuracy and tactical awareness.
Momentarily startled encountering teammate Deke aiming past him, but quickly understands the situation and holds position.
Takes a breath after the assault, allowing himself a moment to recover and absorb the success rather than rushing prematurely.
Receives SWAT patch and respect from team and leader, indicating recognition of competence by peers.
Flirts confidently with two women and gives a clever, playful answer about his job before quickly responding to his pager and tearing away on his bike.
Turns to a disappointed Deke and makes a lighthearted comment about the typical call-out, showing shared camaraderie.
Jokes with Hondo about 'Macking at the beach' and needing a booty call, displaying casual and friendly rapport.
Tries to raise the bus on the radio and signals suspicion about the situation, showing concern for the team's safety.
Fires back at attackers to defend himself and his team during an ambush.
Raises the bus on the radio, attempts communication proactively.
Expresses suspicion about the situation, indicating awareness something is wrong.
Caught totally off guard by the ambush, fails to anticipate the attack.
Quickly reacts to the ambush by firing at the attackers effectively.
Realizes his weapon is out of ammo while facing an armed enemy but stays alive by quickly reloading.
Follows Alex promptly into the alley to maintain tactical advantage and continue engagement.
Chases and apprehends a dangerous suspect (Alex) despite being fired upon and physically attacked, showing physical skill and persistence.
Loses balance and falls during the struggle, momentarily losing the upper hand.
Quickly applies flexcuffs to the suspect once subdued, demonstrating procedural knowledge and quick recovery.
Exchanges look of shared understanding and seriousness with Hondo, showing solidarity.
Jerks Alex away from the podium to maintain order and professionalism during press conference.
Remains composed and shares a confident look with Hondo during the high-pressure press conference involving a major criminal.
Looks a little overwhelmed by the media attention and intense environment at the press conference.
Expresses remorse about the consequences of killing, showing awareness of victims' families and emotional impact.
Shrugs off reporters' harsh questions with sarcastic humor, indicating some defensiveness but also camaraderie with Sanchez.
Stands aside during press interaction and allows others to handle the situation; drinks water and splashes it on his face to maintain composure.
Responds to Sanchez's cynical comment with dry humor about the investigators' questions.
Expresses deep remorse and uncertainty about the moral consequences of their actions, showing internal conflict and self-doubt.
Helps Alex out of the helicopter despite tense situation.
Makes a light, sarcastic comment calling the operation a 'circus' and the prisoner 'trash.'
Acknowledges flying the helicopter and agrees to pilot it without hesitation.
Helps Alex out of the building calmly in a high tension situation.
Engages in light banter calling Alex 'kingpin' to ease tension before flight.
Expresses anger and disdain towards Alex, indicating protective feelings towards the team/honored members.
Engages cooperatively in planning with team members, focusing on safety and secrecy.
Makes a remark on the Swat Captain’s bald head (looking at it), showing a moment of humor or levity.
Identifies that whoever shot down the helicopter has done it before and will do it again.
Engages in discussion about the difficulty of driving a captive out of the city under dangerous conditions, contributing to planning.
Passes out radios willingly to Boxer when asked.
Engages in casual banter with Sanchez, showing lightheartedness.
Admires the armored SUV confidently, accepts responsibility to distribute radios to team members.
Engages in light banter with Sanchez but quickly follows orders and prepares for mission accurately.
Jokes lightly in a tense moment when entering the storm drain tunnel, maintaining composure.
Leads the effort to move into a dangerous underground tunnel environment with the team, showing confidence.
Encourages Alex to come down into the tunnel despite Alex's reluctance, helping team cohesion and mission progress.
Makes light-hearted comments to ease tension ('The guys in the convoy are chillin'... Not that I'm complaining.')
Jokes with teammates and engages in friendly banter with Alex and Sanchez
Shows attentiveness and concern by signaling Sanchez to be still upon hearing a noise
Does not respond defensively to Alex's intimidating look and instead keeps the team moving

Moves cautiously and stealthily through the storm drain with the team, exits the storm drain with the others efficiently, participates in a quick and stealthy operation getting into the disguised van.
Responds with sarcasm to Alex's sincere offer to work together and tries to deflect with humor about being a 'henchman'
Glares at Alex after she makes a friendly, cooperative suggestion
Engages in light teasing with teammates about retirement plans and future perks
Asks pertinent questions about the convoy attack, shows awareness of the seriousness of the situation.
Responds sarcastically and somewhat dismissively to Alex's attempt at cooperation.
Expresses serious commitment to protecting the public by saying he would take a bullet to keep a criminal off the streets.
Glares at Alex after suspecting him of betrayal, verbally accuses him of opening his mouth and causing an ambush.
Identifies the seriousness of the threat posed by Alex and expresses willingness to sacrifice himself to keep a criminal off the streets, showing conviction and responsibility.
Glares at Alex and suspects a betrayal, showing situational awareness and critical thinking when the team is ambushed.
Keys his radio and calls for help while under attack.
Excuses himself after sprawling on top of Sanchez during a sharp turn.
Helps Sergeant Howard keep moving despite his injury, supporting him.
Throws a flashbang grenade first to protect team and orders everyone to move to safety, being last through the gate and shutting it behind to secure the area.
Takes a quick peek over the fence despite heavy gunfire, showing concern for tactical awareness but risks personal safety for the team's benefit.
Throws a flashbang stun grenade to disorient enemies, allowing his team to escape a dangerous situation.
Last to enter the backyard and shuts the gate behind the team, showing situational awareness and responsibility.
Takes a quick peek over the fence despite heavy gunfire and finds no target.
Volunteers to face danger directly, expressing preference to be shot rather than burned.
Acts decisively and cooperatively with his team, covering others to ensure their safety.
Dart across the alley under enemy fire, take up firing position with teammates, return fire effectively.
Cuts Deke's plastic cuffs to free him quickly.
Gives Deke his pistol without hesitation.
Tells teammates to stay back for safety during sniper fire.
Quickly cuts plastic cuffs to free a teammate and promptly provides a weapon to him, enabling immediate action.
Recognizes Poker as a highly skilled sniper and orders his team to stay put while he takes cover and returns fire, showing tactical awareness.
Looks on in disbelief as Sanchez collapses, then quickly strips off her vest and applies first aid to her wound, reassuring her.
Futilely empties his MP-5 at the escaping helicopter after Sanchez is shot.
Grabs Hondo by the shoulders and firmly encourages action to not let the suspects get away.
Calmly questions paramedics about Sanchez's condition, showing concern for a teammate.
Challenges the pilot's authority by insisting he does not need permission to proceed due to the emergency and SWAT status.
Insists they will get the suspects and encourages Hondo to pursue despite the risk, showing decisiveness and confidence.
Tells the pilot that he doesn’t need permission to fly, demonstrating assertiveness and confidence in urgent situations.
Encourages team unity with 'We're all we need' and shares fist taps with teammates.
Assesses the escape and evasion skills of the suspect, indicating awareness of the tactical situation.
Affirms team's ability to operate independently with confidence ('We're all we need') and encourages unity.
Takes control of the falling helicopter to save others.
Recognizes the threat immediately and tells others to turn the helicopter to avoid incoming fire.
Takes control of the helicopter after the pilot and co-pilot are hit, attempts to stabilize it despite being under extreme pressure.
Quickdraws his pistol and shoots the camouflaged sniper to protect his team.
Watches the helicopter roll away uninjured but is concerned for his team's safety.
Quickdraws his pistol and accurately shoots the camouflaged sniper who was almost invisible, saving Hondo.
Watches the helicopter crash with bewilderment initially but quickly transitions to action by running through dust and assessing the situation.
Calmly analyzes the tactical situation and correctly predicts the enemy's plan to flank them and cut them down in crossfire.
Shoots into the windows of the buried school bus covering teammates as they advance on the bunker.
Lays down cover fire with Deke to allow TJ to reload and advance.
Quickly reacts to teammate being hit (TJ) and grabs him to assist.
Saves TJ's life by pulling him inside the bunker under fire, shares a fist tap as a sign of brotherhood.
Leads teammates carefully through dangerous tunnels, shows protective and considerate behavior.
Focuses on tactical moves and survival, no direct interaction with enemies or outsiders that would show tolerance or friendliness.
Follows Hondo while firing and helps drop all three Guardians, showing coordinated and effective combat performance.
Runs out with Deke and Hondo to intercept the returning Longranger, indicating readiness and quick response in a high-pressure situation.
Clears corners and blind angles with Hondo, running on instinct and skill.
Gets stunned by grenade blast but recovers as Hondo helps him up and moves out.
Charges Poker to prevent him from reloading, engaging in close combat to protect his team.
Uses overwhelming rage and relentless fighting techniques to overpower Poker.
Insists on handling the fight himself despite exhaustion and adversity.
Sets handcuffs on defeated opponent and formally arrests him.
About to deliver potentially fatal stomp to opponent's neck but stopped.
Wipes blood, looks at defeated opponent without gloating or cruelty.
Asks Hondo about the next steps, shows vulnerability by questioning his future.
Refuses help from Hondo, insists on handling the fight himself, demonstrating confidence and ownership of the situation.
Sustains exhaustion and physical damage but perseveres in combat, showing resilience and skill by breaking Poker's legs and overpowering him.
Hesitates to finish Poker by stomping his neck until stopped by Hondo, showing a momentary lack of cold-blooded resolve needed in such scenarios.
Uses handcuffs on Poker after incapacitating him, following proper protocol to arrest instead of overstepping or losing control.
Speaks uncertainly about his future after the fight ('Should I retire?'), indicating momentary self-doubt or reflection but not incompetence.
Drops Alex De Leon and Poker unceremoniously in the dirt, showing no empathy.
Explicitly identifies Poker as the man who shot down the helicopter to the Marine Colonel, showing responsibility and straightforwardness.
Shows indifference to Poker's hateful look as he is taken away.
Successfully helps apprehend two high-value suspects, including the man who shot down a military helicopter, and confidently identifies him to the Marine colonel.
Shows indifference to hostile glare from Poker once Poker is apprehended, maintaining focus on the mission.
